text.title: Goal of the study: to find out how humans perceive Symmetries in real world scenes
text.sym-tutorial: Need a refresher on "Symmetry"? Click here: Understanding Symmetry
text.sym-instruction:
1. Label every symmetry you perceive on each image.
  2. Choose which type of symmetry to be labeled first.
  3. Use mouse scroll to zoom in/out the image for more precise labeling.
  4. Click the Submit button or press ENTER to finish current task.
  5. Buttons & Hotkeys:
    1. Click Rotation/Reflection flip switch or press R to toggle between label rotation and reflection.
    2. Click Label/Deletion flip switch or press D to toggle between labeling and deleting.
    3. Click the Undo Last button or press CTRL+Z to undo last Annotation/Deletion.
    4. Click the Reset View button or press CTRL+X center the image and reset zoom.
    5. Click the Clear All button to clear all annotations. Warning: this action cannot be recovered!

text.sym-legend:
Red Circle -- Rotation Symmetry Center
Green Line -- Reflection Axis
text.task-description:
For this task, you will need to:
  • Familiarize yourself with Symmetry Labeling:
    • Read through the Understanding Symmetry Tutorial.
    • Pass a quick test (label 4 sample images) on Symmetry Labeling.
    • Complete a short background survey with your WorkerID.
  • Label images.
You may choose to skip at most images, but skipped images are not counted towards the labeled images.
You will receive a basic reward of $ for the completion of the task, and at most a bonus reward of $ based on the number of labeled images.
You may do this symmetry labeling HIT only once.
